revised_title: Investigating the Electrical Effects of Heat on Living Tissues
tldr: The author conducted experiments to study the effect of heat on the electrical state of living tissues, including muscle, nerve, and skin. They discovered that moderate heat has an opposite effect on tissues compared to local excitation and excessive heat, which is antidromic to the current aroused by electrical excitation. The findings suggest that the first electrical effect of moderate local heat is anti-excitatory.
